com.coveros.selenified.utilities

Class TestSetup

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.coveros.selenified.utilities.TestSetup

  • public class TestSetup
extends Object
    Assists with Selenified class in setting up proxy, hub, and browser details
    Author:
    Max Saperstone

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TestSetup()
      A constructor which sets up the default empty desired capabilities

      • setBrowser

        public static List<Browser> setBrowser()
                                throws InvalidBrowserException
        looks at the browser information passed in, and loads that data into a list
        Returns:
        List: a list of all browsers
        Throws:
        InvalidBrowserException - If a browser that is not one specified in the Selenium.Browser class is used, this exception will be thrown

      • setupBrowserDetails

        public void setupBrowserDetails(Browser browser)
        sets the browser details (name, version, device, orientation, os) into the device capabilities
        Parameters:
        browser - - the browser object, with details included

      • setupBrowserCapability

        public void setupBrowserCapability(Browser browser)
                            throws InvalidBrowserException
        Sets the device capabilities based on the browser selection
        Parameters:
        browser - - which browser are we running with
        Throws:
        InvalidBrowserException - If a browser that is not one specified in the Selenium.Browser class is used, this exception will be thrown

      • setupDriver

        public static org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver setupDriver(Browser browser,
                                                        org.openqa.selenium.remote.DesiredCapabilities capabilities)
                                                 throws InvalidBrowserException
        this creates the webdriver object, which will be used to interact with for all browser web tests
        Parameters:
        browser - - what browser is being tested on
        capabilities - - what capabilities are being tested with
        Returns:
        WebDriver: the driver to interact with for the test
        Throws:
        InvalidBrowserException - If a browser that is not one specified in the Selenium.Browser class is used, this exception will be thrown

      • setupScreenSize

        public static void setupScreenSize(App app)
        Sets up the initial size of the browser. Checks for the passed in parameter of screensize. If set to width x height, sets the browser to that size; if set to maximum, maximizes the browser.
        Parameters:
        app - - the application to be tested, contains all control elements

        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getTestName

        public static String getTestName(Method method,
                                 Object... dataProvider)
        Determines the unique test name, based on the parameters passed in
        Parameters:
        method - - the method under test to extract the name from
        dataProvider - - an array of objects being passed to the test as data providers
        Returns:
        String: a unique name

      • getTestName

        public static String getTestName(String packageName,
                                 String className,
                                 String methodName,
                                 Object... dataProvider)
        Determines the unique test name, based on the parameters passed in
        Parameters:
        packageName - - the package name of the test method as a string
        className - - the class name of the test method as a string
        methodName - - the method name of the test as a string
        dataProvider - - an array of objects being passed to the test as data providers
        Returns:
        String: a unique name

      • parseMap

        public static Map<String,String> parseMap(String input)
        Breaks up a string, and places it into a map. ampersands (&) are used to split into key value pairs, while equals (=) are used to assign key vs values
        Parameters:
        input - - a string, with key and values separated by an equals (=) and pairs separated by an ampersand (&)
        Returns:
        Map: a map with values
